station module

class station.Station(env: Environment, station_id: int, position: tuple, charging_time: float, max_concurrent_charging: int, vehicles: StationStorage)

Bases: object

A class representing a charging station for electric vehicles.

Attributes: - id (int): The unique identifier of the station. - charging_time (float): The time it takes to fully charge a vehicle. - max_concurrent_charging (int): The maximum number of vehicles that can be charged simultaneously. - vehicles (StationStorage): The storage object containing the vehicles currently at the station. - env (simpy.Environment): The simulation environment. - position (tuple): The (x, y) coordinates of the station. - charging_vehicles (dict): A dictionary containing the vehicles currently being charged and their corresponding charging processes.

charge(vehicle: Vehicle, now: float)

Charges a vehicle at the station.

Parameters: - vehicle (Vehicle): The vehicle to be charged. - now (float): The current simulation time.

Yields: - A timeout event representing the time it takes to charge the vehicle.

charge_next_vehicle()

Starts charging the next vehicle in the queue, if any.

distance(station)

Calculates the Euclidean distance between this station and another station.

Parameters: - station (Station): The other station.

Returns: - The Euclidean distance between the two stations.

request_lock(vehicle: Vehicle)

Requests a lock for the given vehicle.

Parameters: - vehicle (Vehicle): The vehicle to be locked.

Yields: - A lock event for the vehicle.

request_unlock(user)

Requests an unlock for the given user.

Parameters: - user: The user to be unlocked.

Yields: - An unlock event for the user.

start_charging()

Starts charging vehicles up to the maximum number of concurrent charging allowed.

stop_charging()

Stops charging all vehicles currently being charged.
